abstracts.cdata!:
One of the objectives of the Municipal
            Solid Waste Management Project is to remediate environmental
            pollution and modernize the Getlini landfill site to
            international good practice standards.  The purpose of this
            environmental assessment is to identify the potential
            environmental impacts which may result from the proposed
            remediation and extension of the existing Getlini landfill
            site, to assess their significance and to identify
            mitigation measures.  Leachate, which is produced directly
            from liquid waste and refuse moisture content, will be
            arrested, collected, and treated.  Surface runoff from waste
            pile, which is a source of water pollution, will be directed
            to surface ditches and treated prior to discharge to the
            Daugava.  A study of water quality, pollutant loadings, and
            hydrodynamics will be conducted to minimize the potential of
            adverse impacts on water quality in the Daugava.  Road
            maintenance and regular sweeping can minimize dust emissions
            from landfill operation.  Noise generated from construction
            and operation of the landfill site will be monitored, and a
            noise action plan will be prepared.  Air quality impacts
            from waste haulage vehicles can be mitigated by proper
            maintenance of the vehicles.
